snippet: New research suggests that vermicompost, a worm-created soil additive, helps plants grow with more vigor, and makes them more resistant to disease and insects, than those grown with other types of composts and fertilizers.
abstract: Research suggests vermicompost, worm-created soil additive, helps plants grow with more vigor, and makes them more resistant to disease and insects than those grown with other types of composts and fertilizers; worm compost costs almost 10 times price of other composts, but growers say it is worth the price in yields.
lead_paragraph: New research suggests that vermicompost, a worm-created soil additive, helps plants grow with more vigor, and makes them more resistant to disease and insects, than those grown with other types of composts and fertilizers.

headline.seo: Worms Produce Another Kind of Gold for Farmers
headline.main: Worms Produce Another Kind of Gold for Growers
headline.print_headline: Worms Produce Another Kind of Gold for Growers
